description: Contracts page renders three tabs: Templates, Client Contracts, Drafts
Drafts tab is clickable and switches to drafts view
Drafts tab shows badge with count when drafts exist
Drafts tab badge updates after creating a new draft
Drafts tab badge updates after discarding a draft
Drafts tab shows no badge when count is zero
getDraftContracts returns only contracts with status='draft'
getDraftContracts filters by current tenant
getDraftContracts returns empty array when no drafts exist
getDraftContracts includes client_name from joined companies table
getDraftContracts orders by updated_at descending by default
Drafts DataTable renders contract name for each draft
Drafts DataTable renders client name for each draft
Drafts DataTable renders created date in localized format
Drafts DataTable renders last modified date in localized format
Drafts DataTable renders actions dropdown for each row
Actions dropdown contains Resume option
Actions dropdown contains Discard option
Clicking column header sorts by that column
Search input filters drafts by contract name
Search input filters drafts by client name
Search is case-insensitive
Pagination controls appear when drafts exceed page size
Pagination controls navigate between pages
Empty state displays when no drafts exist
Empty state shows appropriate message about saving drafts
getDraftContractForResume returns complete wizard data for a draft
getDraftContractForResume includes contract lines
getDraftContractForResume includes service configurations
getDraftContractForResume throws error if contract is not a draft
Clicking Resume opens ContractWizard dialog
Resumed wizard displays with draft data loaded
Resumed wizard starts at Step 1 (Contract Basics)
Step 1 shows pre-populated client selection from draft
Step 1 shows pre-populated contract name from draft
Step 1 shows pre-populated dates from draft
Step 2 (Fixed Fee) shows pre-populated services from draft
Step 3 (Products) shows pre-populated products from draft
Step 4 (Hourly) shows pre-populated hourly services from draft
Step 5 (Usage) shows pre-populated usage services from draft
Step 6 (Review) shows complete draft data for review
Clicking Save Draft in resumed wizard updates existing draft
Save Draft does not create a duplicate contract
Save Draft preserves the original contract_id
Completing resumed wizard sets contract status to 'active'
Completing resumed wizard sets is_active to true
Activated contract no longer appears in Drafts tab
Activated contract appears in Client Contracts tab
Clicking Discard opens confirmation dialog
Confirmation dialog displays contract name
Confirmation dialog displays client name
Confirmation dialog displays warning about permanent deletion
Confirmation dialog has Cancel button
Confirmation dialog has Discard button
Clicking Cancel closes dialog without deleting
Clicking Discard calls deleteContract action
Deleted draft no longer appears in list
Deletion shows success toast notification
Deletion error shows error toast notification
Drafts list refreshes automatically after successful deletion
Tab badge count updates after deletion
User from different tenant cannot see other tenant's drafts
User without contract create permission cannot resume drafts
User without contract delete permission cannot discard drafts
